storyInfo: The Doctor makes the ultimate choice between the civilization of the past and the present. At a place unknown to any others, the Doctor meets with Theresis.

attributes.content: Enable administrator-level encryption.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Image number <color=#FF4200>(0018_admin)</color>.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Activating recorder... Beginning video record.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: While I slept, the ruins of our homeland nurtured new life.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Originium is what guides their development, reshaping the lifeforms from Talos-II to have a similar appearance to us.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I am rather fortunate. I have been able to leap across the millennia to communicate with them. I have even considered myself one of the people of this land for a time, experiencing their past and future.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But in the end, I am not of here. I have even begun to feel... uneasy about Theresa's efforts.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: If the Originium Project ends in failure, no, even if it is merely postponed for some time... Theresa, Kal'tsit, even the future that I promised to Amiya...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The inhabitants of this planet, some of the few lifeforms known to us, are but illusions that will break at the slightest touch.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I have been lying to them and to myself for a very long time now. But... how will I explain it to Kal'tsit? Or to Theresa, or Amiya?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Am I supposed to tell them that all the pain they have been through is the key to their salvation, and they must stop fighting?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That all of Terran civilization is a fleeting dream, and only by being assimilated into Originium will we have the opportunity to avert our fate?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Seeing the lives of those they call the Infected dissipate like smoke brings pain to my heart.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It has long been a common sight on Terra, but it always marks the end of life—sorrowful and cruel.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It has been too long since I've heard a voice full of life. I can't just see them as unexpected sparks.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But what I see cannot be called a warrior's death.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Rather, they have given in to the Originium's assimilation, passing through death to join the Assimilated Universe, a chance where life can break through the deepest darkness.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Should I bow in silence at their deaths...? Or should I quietly rejoice at the smooth progression of the project?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It is for this reason that Theresa dedicates herself to her research. Kal'tsit, our AMa-10, has also chosen to believe in the potential of Terra, chosen to resist Originium and put an end to war...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But what about me?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The Originium Project was built upon the efforts of countless generations, and in that time, billions of our compatriots have died, all in exchange for a mere ten thousand years that I have spent waiting and waiting.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And now, the flint and tinder are in my hands. After all the long years. How could I abandon it?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Because Terra has left me pleasantly surprised in a few short years? Because of the choices that Theresa and Kal'tsit made?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Even if Amiya has moved me to compassion, would I not have been the selfish one all along?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They... awakened me to be their salvation, but in truth, I am destined to bring them to annihilation.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: They awakened me, their destroyer, as if I were their savior...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: (Chokes back tears)
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Amiya... Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: What should I do?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Priestess... What should I do?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.text: Perhaps I should reveal everything to Kal'tsit and Theresa.
Originium has led them down roughly the correct path. Arrogant though it may be, this has been sufficient for these souls to perform a new kind of miracle.
<color=#000000>Perhaps I must re-examine Theresa and Kal'tsit's plan.</color>

<color=#000000>Babel's research has proceeded faster than expected, but Terra's political structure is rather primitive, and Babel does not yet have the ability to transcend the barriers of race and nation so that it may represent Terra as a whole.</color>
Believe in Terra. Believe in the people to build their own future.
<color=#000000>Carry on with the project. At least the vestiges of those who came before can live on within Originium.</color>

attributes.content: Well, how could I ever blame you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I understand your dilemma. Our debates are far beyond what those little lifeforms known as humans could participate in.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But this is the only way. You and I both know that much.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: If, perhaps, we still have time before Its return, we can envision things together, achieve them together. Describe anything and everything within the boundaries of the universe together.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I hope that in those fragile moments, you will always stand by my side.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You will, won't you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: And that concludes my report, Your Highness.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The Military Commission seems to be certain we will retake region C8-10's village and supplies, but by building an outpost there, they have already fallen into a trap.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: There are, however, some officers who have begun to use tactics completely different from Manfred's. This is highly irregular.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Our spies have reported seeing Nachzehrers entering the troops' camp.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Nezzsalem...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: What does the Doctor make of it?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: The Doctor believes that no matter how the Sarkaz God of War intends to participate in this conflict, our arrangements will be thrown into complete disarray.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Everyone is well aware that many members of the Royal Court have always favored the Military Commission, which advocates for reprisals and violence.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: But on account of certain restrictions—ones that you might even call rules of convention—none of them are willing to participate in the civil war.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: If the sovereigns were to decide to wage war upon us in Kazdel, those Sarkaz who have not yet returned would once more be unable to find Babel on the map.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: Practically speaking, if the Court sides against us, the military gap will be concerning. Plus those that support us are, for the most part, not warriors or soldiers.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: For many of our troops, this is the first time they have ever held a weapon.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: This is why I must speak my mind. No matter how you look at the facts, our situation is changing dramatically.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Keep monitoring the Nachzehrer Court.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: If Nezzsalem is no longer holding back, then Duq'arael is likely to act as well.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: For three weeks in a row, 'the Rose Riverside has no Canoes.'
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The Rose Riverside is a most excellent spy network. They are able to deceive anyone they so wish, except for their sovereign lord.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Tell them to pull out immediately. Leave Kazdel if they must. Lie low in other lands.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It will be done.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: I'll take my leave then, Highness.
attributes.name: Scout

attributes.content: The Royal Court. They possess the most direct capacity to use force. Nezzsalem only agreed to hand over command because he was promised a war that would reshape the land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Although rather troublesome, it is a challenge that we would have had to face sooner or later, if we were to achieve all that we hope for.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Babel does not blindly reject violence. It is clear to us all that if necessary, we must use force to defend our beliefs.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: But this also means that the Sarkaz will further devour themselves, venting the hate they hold for the land by setting themselves ablaze.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: It will mean the end of us.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Defeating the Military Commission will not solve all our problems. We must give closure to those Sarkaz who have grown up knowing only hatred and suffering, in other regards as well.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As for Oripathy and Originium, we—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Please, enter.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Your Highness.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Your wounds have not yet fully healed, Ascalon. There is no need for you to make your report in person.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I've recovered. Besides, this is top priority. Hoederer's team has successfully intercepted a witchcraft decoder.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: The Doctor has already begun deciphering our enemy's codes. I believe we should see results soon.
attributes.name: Ascalon
Theresa
attributes.content: Is that so...?

attributes.name: Theresa
attributes.content: Ines. W.
You have done very well.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Thank you, Your Highness. I hope we'll crack our enemy's comms as quickly as possible, so we can plan our next ops.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Where is your captain, by the way?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Hoederer took a few flesh wounds, nothing too serious. He's getting treated in the infirmary right now.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: If that is the case, then I will not waste your time. Go to him.
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: Of course. Thank you kindly, Highness.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: W.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Eh? What?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Go to Hoederer.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: Oh. I...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Alright, got it.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Guess he still ain't dead...
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: If that is all, Your Highness, I have other business—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: That reminds me...
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: I still haven't thought of a real name for the girl, have I?
attributes.name: Theresa

attributes.content: 1093, Winter
Weather/Rainy
Kazdel Border, Kazdel
The Doctor listens to the pitter-patter of the rain on the leaves, eyes closed.
Drip. Drop.
The Doctor's heart rages, filled with torment. A fowlbeast cries out in the distance.
Answer my questions, or die here.
Ask away.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Are you betraying Babel?
I've never been a Babel member, but I've also never abandoned them to face their struggles alone.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Why have you come to me?
I have a request.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I will not speak to a myth with no name... evil spirit.
Who are you?
...{@nickname}. Doctor {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: ...{@nickname}.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresis lowers his weapon, the rain falling from the corners of his eyes onto the earth.
He does not look at the one who invited him to this clandestine meeting, instead gazing upwards at the colossal statues of so-called heroes.
Statues raised to commemorate the founding of the nomadic city of Kazdel by a pair of twins.
Even after a hundred years, his stone self still stands, sword drawn, by her side, despite the best efforts of Catastrophe and storm.
Not long after she had crushed the rebellion that sought to destroy the new city, the joyful people of Kazdel invited us to witness the unveiling of these two statues.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: (Ancient Sarkaz language) Heroes.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They were to watch over the border we had marked with our own two hands for generations to come, warning our foes, welcoming our friends.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I once swore an oath to her below her statue. My sword would behead all who stand against her.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Doctor stares at the statue of Theresis, gaze unbreaking.
Does the Military Commission not stand against her?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No. There is no part of Kazdel that has truly risen up against her. Her foe is me, and me alone.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And what of you?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Theresis looks at the figure before him: Rainwater gathering at the hem of a long, hooded coat, rhythmically dripping onto the ground.
The shallow puddles below ripple as falling drops strike them.
You ought to remember that most Sarkaz who once lived here have long since died, lost to history. There are only a handful left who know how to find this place.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You came here on foot. How far have you walked?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Very far.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You have broken the witchcraft cipher created by Manfred's team that he's so proud of.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I did that a long time ago. I just never told anybody.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Even Theresa believes that I only began my work recently. Meaning, I'm in possession of nearly all of the Military Commission's battle plans.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: So I created this opportunity to meet you. Alone.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You are confident that I would not kill the strategist who poses the greatest threat?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I am confident that what I'm about to offer is worth enough that you wouldn't.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Technology that can control Originium.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: How far can you go under so much pressure from Victoria? How do you plan to completely change the Sarkaz, and even this entire land?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I can give you the answer you need.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: You are a boastful one.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: So, what is it you wish me to do, evil spirit?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...Destroy Babel. Scatter her followers. Let Theresa in on your plans.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Unify the Sarkaz under a Kazdel ruled by the Military Commission.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The Doctor has imagined the emotions that speaking these words would incite, many times over.
'Destroy Babel'...
Only a sense of relief came over the Doctor.
The Doctor stares at the statue of Theresa, unmoving, without the slightest hint of emotion.
She and I have never relied on the charity of our enemies, in the course of leading Kazdel to where it stands today.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It is true that this war will only end with the decisive defeat of one of us. But you should not be the one to propose it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Proceed. Tell me more of why you would make this request, evil spirit of an age long gone.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You already know. There are no surprises here. Considering the near two hundred years you and Theresa spent working together, you should be able to guess.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I seek... the expansion of Originium.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Babel's struggles will only prolong the dying gasps of this land, Theresis.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: No matter if you resist it or accept it, Originium will take on myriad forms, drawing all of civilization into her embrace.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Have you ever... looked up at the sky?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Beyond that sky, far beyond the twin moons, there is a place that we would once return to, where we would sleep peacefully.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: But I am the only one left, here speaking with you. In the course of the Sarkaz's eternal search for the remains of dead gods to fend off your enemies, have you ever wondered...?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Why did those gods die?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: The rain intensifies. The Doctor draws tight that trademark hood, and stands below the towering statues.
The shadows of the statues envelop the Doctor, making this figure seem ever more insignificant.
Theresis suddenly feels that the one standing before him in the rain is even harder to read than before.
The burden I bear is greater than the future of the Sarkaz. If I must destroy some things to create a ladder I hope for...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I will do it. It's all I can do.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: I've already hesitated for far too long.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Destroy some things, to create a ladder...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You speak lightly of sacrifice.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Nothing light here, Theresis.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Believe me when I say, you couldn't even conceive of what I've been through.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: And where do I see your sincerity for our cooperation?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Is the Shard not enough for you? Otherwise, even with the help of the Confessarii, you—
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: It is not. It is far from enough, evil spirit.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: It is only enough to spare your life. Only enough to stop me, leader of the Military Commission, from killing a fated foe here and now.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I require an even more direct means to advance this war to the next stage.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If you wish for the Babel members to be spared, then so be it.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Military Commission promises you that as long as Babel concedes defeat and departs Kazdel, we will not exterminate those who desert or surrender.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: But you know what you must do in return.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: No... You can't...
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Who would have thought that the evil spirit, who so roused the interest of the Nachzehrer King, would be such a coward?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You can't both let Theresa live and allow the Babel members to leave safely; it's a total contradiction.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Only with the destruction of Babel and the complete eradication of its members can Theresa leave for Londinium with me.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Otherwise, it would merely be a case of the Military Commission quashing and dispersing yet another group of civilians, migrants, and pacifists.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Even without my order, such things will happen naturally.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Perhaps you believe that Theresa would be willing to step back and watch it before her eyes? She will not. And so she will resist.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You know what I ask of you. If you truly wish to save the many who stand by your side, make them willingly admit defeat and surrender to me...
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Then slay their king.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: And then, I will allow Babel to leave. As it collapses, it will no longer be considered a Sarkaz endeavor, and it will grow weak, drifting to the edges of civilization.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: 'Destroy some things to create a ladder', {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: You're right. There is nothing light about this.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: In your opinion, what is the meaning behind this civil war? What meaning would her death hold?
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Reclaiming our lands, rebuilding our homes, ending discrimination, and revitalizing our race. You will have heard these platitudes many times.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: They are too complex, and yet too simple.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Merely a small and pitiful species trying to grasp their fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: In that case, I will tip the scales of destiny.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Destroy Babel, divide them, weaken them. Allow them to return to their former lives, so that they can know a moment of peace in the final century.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That way... we don't have to kill Theresa. Or at the very least, we can minimize the loss of life.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: Fretting over violence serves only to stifle you. You understand the Sarkaz better than most, but perhaps still not well enough.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: I have a question myself, Dr. {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Evil spirit of a bygone age, you who call yourself a giant, a god, a supreme creator, one who can dictate the fate of the Sarkaz. Are you the only one of your kind?
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: ...I am.
attributes.name: Doctor

attributes.content: That is good to know. Go, now, without guilt, and do what you have decided to do.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: If you worry there will be no one to tear you down from your lofty heights, or judge your sins. Don't. I will do it, evil spirit.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: Until there are none left to toy with our fate.
attributes.name: Theresis

attributes.content: The Doctor listens to the splashing of the puddles behind, the sound of footsteps fading into the distance.
Theresis is gone, wishing to stay not a moment longer.
Pale sunlight begins to seep through the gaps between the statues.
The Doctor cannot feel the slightest bit of warmth from it.
The heroes continue to gaze into the distance. They do not look beneath their feet.
There stands a figure who does not leave for a long, long time.
